definition: to act stupid/to play dumb/to pretend to not know
adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack

sentences.english: This may imply world-weariness or a no-bullshit attitude.
sentences.chinese: 這可以暗示一種厭世的或者“少跟我裝蒜”的態度。

sentences.english: Stop posing and tell us what you really think.
sentences.chinese: 別裝蒜啦，告訴我們你的真實想法吧。

sentences.english: Come off it, Tom, we know you married her for money.
sentences.chinese: 別裝蒜了，湯姆，我們都知道你與她結婚是爲了錢。

sentences.english: How many people and things in their fragile lives could bear feigning ignorance or strangeness?
sentences.chinese: 脆弱的人生又能有多少人和事經得起裝蒜與矜持？

definition: lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
to make a fool of oneself
lit. 300 silver taels not hidden here (idiom); fig. to reveal what one intends to hide
pinyin: ci3 di4 wu2 yin2 san1 bai3 liang3

definition: to play dirty tricks/to be up to mischief
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
lit. neither a relative nor a friend (idiom)/fig. unrelated to one another in any way
